Description: Rim sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery light chalice; creamy white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below with traces of faded palmette in added white and red; exterior, glaze fired light orange-brown: at rim, simple guilloche pattern between pairs of narrow bands; below, painted decoration consisting of head of woman to right, wearing wreath and earring.
Curator's comments: ALthough the figure is identified as female, based on the earring, the cap is the same as those worn by komasts on the Black Figure Komast chalices. for parallels, see Cambrdige Fitzwilliam GR.92.1899 and British Museum 1888,0601.548.n.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 278, no. 751, pl. III, pl. 98)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0728) (phase 2)
